commentaire: Hopefully this review might help someone looking for some info setting up a French account for their business! I'm English, but living and working in France and I needed a bank account for my freelance business. I need to transfer money back to the UK regularly so I wanted something with easy currency exchange. Here's what you need to know - to have a business or earn money in France you need a French IBAN, otherwise you won't be able to pay your taxes. Not necessarily a French bank account, but a French IBAN as the government websites don't accept non-French IBANs. N26 and Revolut both say they offer one, but unless you are on their most expensive account, they don't. Long story short, I tried N26 and Revolut's mid-range business accounts - neither offered me a French IBAN, despite me living in France and having a French registered business. I swapped to Qonto and couldn't be happier. I can generate my invoices there, get paid, have a separate account to save my tax money into, and the price is competitive with N26 and Revolut. Sending money to the UK is a breeze too as it's considered a SEPA transfer so it's free, even though the UK are no longer in the EU and there's currency exchange involved. I also added my accountant as a member of my team so they can access statements etc. as needed. As an aside, I tried Wise too. Bottom line, just get a Qonto account if you're starting a business in France and save yourself the trouble of shopping around like I did!

titre_com: Qonto - All small businesses should consider them
commentaire: I started using Qonto about 6 years ago when I was creating my first company in France.  Initially I was planning to use HSBC but got so frustrated by their long complex procedures and high cost.  I found Qonto online and decided to give them a go and have never looked back.  They did in 3 days what would have taken more than 3 weeks with HSBC.I have now used Qonto for 3 separate companies and did company creation with Qonto as well as capital increases.  In all cases it was simple, straight forward and the pricing is much better than a traditional bank.My only slight complaint is that Qonto limit the number of incoming and outgoing payments depending on the tariff you are on after which you have to pay a supplement.  If you have a lot of incoming and outgoing payments each month this can get expensive, so this is the only thing to watch out for.Otherwise great service and so much easier than a traditional bank, which often make you jump through hoops to do the simplest of things.Unfortunately I have had to close the account with Qonto for one of my companies, simply because I needed a business loan and was forced to open an account with the bank providing the loan and there was no point to pay for two accounts.

titre_com: Misleading Promises and Unreliable Service: My Qonto Experience in Italy
commentaire: I opened a Qonto account for my new startup in Milan, Italy, incorporated on August 1st. Qonto repeatedly assured me that their issues with Banca D'Italia wouldn't affect my account since I started the opening process before July 25th. This turned out to be completely false.While I managed to open the account and incorporate my company, Qonto recently informed me they couldn't activate ANY cards for my account due to their regulatory issues in Italy. This directly contradicts what they promised earlier, as evidenced by an email from their representative Alessandro, who stated:"The restrictions apply only to future customers, therefore the account opening process for TWINI S.R.L. is not impacted in any way."Now I'm left with a useless bank account, forced to transfer funds to a new bank and close this account as soon as possible. There's also a risk they might retain the currently deposited money, similar to what N26 did during a comparable situation in Italy.This feels like a bait-and-switch. Qonto told me one thing at the beginning and the opposite now. When I called them, they claimed they couldn't do anything about it and that the problem was beyond their control. The real issue is that they assured me the process would be smooth because I was before the deadline, only to completely change their stance a month later.Qonto's actions are deceptive and unprofessional. They're likely to face significant problems in Italy and lose substantial market share. I've decided to switch to Revolut instead.In conclusion, my experience with Qonto has been deeply disappointing. Their misleading promises and inability to provide basic banking services make them an unreliable choice for businesses in Italy. I strongly advise caution to anyone considering Qonto for their banking needs.
reponses: Ciao Davide,Abbiamo letto molto attentamente la recensione che ci hai lasciato.Qonto ha ricevuto un ordine da Banca dâ€™Italia per migliorare le sue misure anti-riciclaggio nella sua filiale italiana. Questo ordine include un divieto temporaneo di onboarding per i nuovi clienti in Italia a partire dal 25 luglio 2024.Ci scusiamo per la poca chiarezza della comunicazione relativa alla restrizione dell'ordine di nuove carte, tuttavia ti confermiamo che al momento non Ã¨ possibile procedere con tale funzionalitÃ .Ti assicuriamo che stiamo lavorando diligentemente per rispettare tutte le normative vigenti e per minimizzare l'impatto sui nostri clienti.Un nostro agente si Ã¨ giÃ  messo in contatto con te per proporti un gesto commerciale per scusarci dell'accaduto.Se hai bisogno di ulteriori chiarimenti o assistenza, non esitare a rispondere a questa email.Buona giornata

Getting now invoices for this period of time is absolutely not understandable, creates unnecessary overhead added to the issues caused in the first place already.

commentaire: This is by far the best user experience I've ever made with a bank. First I've tried to open an account for my new company at the online bank of the biggest German bank (with the blue square logo). The process took 4 weeks (!!!) with the result that I didn't receive the account - and they have asked for understanding that they cannot explain the reason.Then I decided to give Qonto a try. And my account was ready to receive the initial payments in less than an hour. Everything about Qonto is about speed and comfort. Not only the onboarding but also the support (responds nearly always in less than 10 minutes!), the shipment of the card (less than a week after opening the account) and the whole user experience of the apps (web app and mobile app). It is the first time in my life that a bank transfer has been fun.Also the fees are low, they don't have transfer limits, all transfers are in real time for free and so on. Everything is perfect.After all of these amazing experiences with Qonto I wonder how the traditional banks in Germany will survive. That will be difficult for them.

titre_com: Lost 30.000 euros due to a bug!
commentaire: We've lost nearly 30.000 euros due to a bug on their website. One of our bulk payments went out twice, to hundreds of contractors. They've provided no compensation, we've been talking to their team for 2h / day for 2 weeks so far and they keep telling us to wait / speak to someone else/ etc..Some background to this:We've been using Qonto for over 2 years and never had a problem before. We have hundreds of thousands of euros in our account balance. We pay a hefty bill to Qonto every month for transfer fees and service fees. We send out bulk payments every month and never had an issue before. But due to a bug in their website which is totally obvious to all their customer service staff who've examined our case, they sent almost 30.000 euros twice and have not been able to get the money back. Our request for compensation has so far been ignored. We are going to open a legal case against Qonto for not providing a formal compensation. We continue speaking to their team every day about this and they give no solution. Their customer service is worse than awful. I strongly recommend to any business to avoid them.
reponses: Hello M.Benedito, We are sorry to hear you had this experience. We will contact you as soon as possible to better assist you. Thank you for your understanding. Have a nice day,

commentaire: Qonto is currently retaining some of my deposits and soliciting extensive, highly confidential personal data under the guise of "regulatory checks." This practice not only breaches privcay but also puts me at risk of defaulting on my payments. None of my other banking partners have implemented such intrusive measures.I cannot advise if one needs to do many wires, especially abroad.
reponses: Hello Arturo, First, we are sorry to hear that you had this experience with us. We take our customers' comments very seriously and take them to improve and take action where appropriate.Please note that our activities are regulated and supervised by the ACPR (Banque de France), for this reason, we are obliged to request additional information and proof of some account transactions. For any further questions, do not hesitate to contact us at careteam@qonto.com, we will be happy to answer all your questions. Have a nice day,

commentaire: Qonto was my bank for 8 months then one day the blocked my account without explanations , I had around â‚¬10 000 on their account and it was an active business account so that was a devastating moment in my life, they blocked the account and all cards, they did not bother on informing me why the had done that, I sent them countless messages they did not respond until 3 months later , they said the were reviewing my account with no further explanations then it took them 3 more months to ask me about the transactions on my account , without asking me for invoices that support the transactions . They then took another 2 to 3 months to tell me that they were  cancelling my account and that they were sorry . Then began another nightmare in the chapter , they decided to transfer all my money back to the companies that paid me and without any proof of their transfers . I was devastated and angry, frustrated and etc . I send them messages they always returned their response in rhetorics and always closing the chat so that I begin a new chat with another agent. This went on for 4 more months , then finally the decided to send me their proofs of transfer which was crucial for me to be able yo get my money back , I had to send that information to the companies , then those companies told me these are not transactions that our company made . Qonto is an incompetent bank with a lot of incompetent agents and managers etc They have the worse services by far and I would never recommend their bank to anyone, I hate fraudulent banks and this one is in that category. Stay away from this bank. Big Disappointment , as said by many they charge the highest fees on international transfers and they never respond to message from customers .
reponses: Hello Foster, We are sorry to read your comment and that our collaboration has suddenly come to an end.We would like to clarify that the response times you mentioned are not true. In fact, our teams were able to respond the same day when you asked us for proof of transfers. It is true, however, that an agent can close a chat if a conversation is already open on the same subject. Our teams are not authorized to give you the reasons for the account closure. However, this is based on verified evidence that has forced us to take this decision. As an ACPR-accredited payment institution, we sometimes have to guide certain customers towards the exit, when their operations or activity do not allow us to meet our legal obligations.We apologize for any impact this closure may have on your business activities. We also hope that you have been able to find an establishment to welcome you quickly.We remain at your disposal should you need us at support@qonto.com.Thank you for your understanding.The Qonto team

reponses: Hello Hamid,We have read your comment carefully and we would like to respond to you in detail.First of all, we feel it is important to point out that as a payment institution, Qonto can never intervene in or close an account without a valid and verified reason. We will not close an account without a thorough investigation. However, we are not in a position to comment publicly on your case. As you know, our business is supervised by the Bank of France and, for regulatory reasons or at the request of the relevant authorities, we may have to take sensitive and restrictive decisions.Qonto is a financial institution, which obliges us to strictly apply the regulations in force: we are not always entitled to explain publicly, and in detail, the reasons for a permanent closure of an account.of an account.We apologize for the impact this closure may have on your business activities. We are at your disposal if you need help at careteam@qonto.com. Thank you for your understanding.

commentaire: The good things first - Qonto is by far the best business account on the market in my opinion. It has everything a company could ask for. The bad things: Most of the "new exciting features" do not work for many many months, because they are still in beta. Which is disastrous for Company accounts. And sadly the worst part of all is their customer service. You always get to speak to an AI rep, a student or a minimum wage person that is only capable of sending you their FAQ. One has to ask a minimum of 3 times to get real support, if it happens at all. This takes at least 2 days. 95% of the time they just send you their FAQs but are not capable of providing any real support - for any kind of issue. This is the biggest drawback this company had since their initiation and still has today. Therefore only 3 stars, despite the system in general being very good.
reponses: Hello Peter, we thank you for your review and would like to reply to your different comments. Qonto is still quite young on the payment institution market, some of our feature might still be in construction. This is why your feedback is very important to us so that our product evolves and gets better everyday. The experience you had with our customer service do not reflect the quality standard of our service we want to offer to our client. We really would like to understand what happened, and how we can improve our service, could you contact us at careteam@qonto.com ? Have a great day,

commentaire: Former Penta customer forced to switch to Qonto. Got tons of emails in the process about all the positive things related to the change. Like keep all the good things with Penta plus add lots of new stuff from Qonto.(for same price - 10 euro)Itâ€™s basically just a scam. With the Qonto starter plan (which according to the tag is the same as my Penta plan) itâ€™s a huge downgrade for the same money. Penta had 100 free transfers per month while Qonto have 30(!!)Card limit on Penta is 20.000 euro per day and with Qonto itâ€™s 1000 Euro per month. 1000 euro per month??? Really? Itâ€™s such a huge downgrade for the same price. Of course I can get high and limits, but then you need to pay a lot more per month. Qonto is not freedom for small businesses but rather the opposite; its restrictions and limits for businesses. The whole change thing seems like a huge scam to get more money for a product that are a downgrade rather then a positive upgrade. Ah and also remember you have to get a new account number and I form all customers, update invoices etcNot the bank to choose if you like flexibility and freedom. Maybe nice if you need accounting tools but I already got that - I just need a nice bank like old Penta.

commentaire: The most unprofessional and incompetent bank I've ever worked with.  Since migrating from Penta to Qonto there have been monthly issues with payments, to both suppliers and employees.   Their reasoning is always because of so called compliance but I've never experienced this level of compliance from bigger banks.  So now I have an issue that payments will randomly take forever to process and then declined.  Latest example is salary payment to employee that went through no problem for two months in a row, and then randomly one month got told they needed additional information to process (which severely delayed payment to employee) - they still have not provided me a reason as to why it went through fine previously and why now they need this additional information.  It's unpredictable and inconsistent.  I have no confidence when payments are being made.  they also have an 'instant payment' feature which half the time fails due to 'technical reasons'.  When I asked them what are the criteria for instant payment to work no-one can provide an answer.  So payments to employees takes up to three days, incredibly slow.  This bank is clearly still in start-up mentality rather then lets act like an actual bank and provide a professional and reliable service.

commentaire: Are you tired of dealing with incompetent banks? Look no further than Qonto, the bank that nearly destroyed my e-commerce business! Despite being a long-term customer of Penta, I have experienced nothing but frustration and disappointment with their unprofessional behavior since it is part of Qonto.Over the past few months, Qonto has failed to successfully transmit my bank transfers, resulting in lost revenue and significant costs. To make matters worse, when the transfers have failed, the money has been lost, and Qonto has not taken the necessary steps to locate it promptly. Their customer service was a mess, and their representatives provided me with inconsistent and unhelpful responses.It is unacceptable that a bank cannot locate a transfer after it has been made and does not have proper protocols in place to handle such issues. As a customer, I expect a high level of service, and Qonto has proven themselves to be incapable of delivering that.I urge other business owners to avoid the hassle and frustration of dealing with an incompetent bank like Qonto. Protect your business and choose a bank that can provide professional and reliable services. Don't let Qonto nearly destroy your business like they did mine!Here are some key takeaways to keep in mind when choosing the right bank for your e-commerce business:Look for a bank that has experience working with e-commerce businesses and understands your unique needs.Choose a bank that has a reliable and efficient payment processing system, so your transactions are processed quickly and accurately.Ensure the bank has proper protocols in place to handle issues such as failed transfers and lost funds. The last thing you want is a bank that cannot locate your funds after they have been transferred.Research the bank's customer service reputation and make sure they are known for providing prompt and helpful responses.Avoid banks with a history of unprofessional behavior and unreliable services. Your business deserves better than that!Don't let an incompetent bank like Qonto nearly destroy your e-commerce business. Choose a bank that can provide the professional and reliable services your business deserves.
reponses: Non spÃ©cifiÃ©

commentaire: I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration with the unprofessional behavior of qonto.  The level of service I have received has been abysmal.I can NOT recommend this bank for any E-commerce business that needs to make money transactions outside of Europe. I am writing this review to protect further business to choose this bank:Over the past 2 months, I have experienced several issues with your bank's failure to successfully transmit my bank transfers. These transfers are critical to the operation of my business, and your bank's inability to handle them properly has caused me significant problems and costs.To make matters worse, when the transfers have failed, the money has been lost, and qonto has not taken the necessary steps to retrieve it promptly. This delay has caused us to lose out on essential revenue.Furthermore, when I have reached out to the customer service team to resolve these issues, I have been met with unhelpful and unsympathetic responses. They have been dismissive of my concerns and have not taken the appropriate steps to address the problem.I am incredibly disappointed that qonto has been so unprofessional in handling my business transactions. As a customer, I expect a high level of service, and this bank has failed to meet those expectations.In conclusion, qonto's failure to provide professional and reliable services has caused us significant problems and costs.I can NOT recommend this bank for any E-commerce business that needs to make money transactions outside of Europe. I am writing this review to protect further business to choose this bank.

titre_com: Forced to switch from Penta to Qonto, now paying 400% more
commentaire: The Qonto product is good. However, I was a Penta client before and was satisfied as well. Penta was purchased by Qonto and I had to switch over to a new Qonto account. This is our experience: First of all, the administrative tasks of switching a business account are massive: all customers, all suppliers, tax authorities etc. need to change the account. We are still not done with this process and it does cost massive time on our end.Second, at Penta I paid 9 Euros per month. I am now paying 49 Euros to get the same service (Essential plan + X card). There is no additional service/ upside for me. Hence, I recommend all Penta users to search for a less pricy alternative other than Qonto if they also make you switch over.Update 1: I reached out to the email address you described but haven't got a reply. Update 2: DATEV integration does not work two-ways. You cannot send DATEV-created bank payments to Qonto. It simply does not exist. This renders Qonto useless for larger or growing companies in Germany. Stay away.
reponses: Hello Christian,Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Iâ€™d love the opportunity to discuss your concerns further in a call.  Unfortunately I could not reach you today.  We want every customerâ€™s experience to be the best possible, and we work hard to make sure that happens. Please feel free to email us at careteam@qonto.com and we will resolve your issue as soon as possible and help with any questions regarding the switch and pricing plan.Thank you for your understanding!Best regardsYour Qonto Team

reponses: Hello, thank you for your feedback.We have tried to reach you by phone to present the joining forces of PENTA with QONTO in details.Regarding your comment, our Smart plan includes more than only just a sub account as an additional service: 1 Mastercard, an accountant access to the account, our Bookkeeping pack, 60 instant SEPA transfers / direct debits + 2 cashed checks, and many advanced features that you can all check on our pricing page: https://qonto.com/en/pricing?select-toggle=soloPlease know that this joining force has the goal to support companies and associations in its daily core business, but also in the growth on the European and German market.The more functional Qonto accounts have been developed as an "all-in-one" finance solution, offering an additional solution for the accounting tasks alongside the bank accounts. Our aim has been to help our customers reduce or even eliminate the cost of additional bookkeeping tool.You can select whichever pricing plan suits your needs and you can also change it whenever you want.If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us by email, chat, or phone.Have a good day.Nina - Care team

titre_com: Qonto closed my account without warningâ€¦
commentaire: Qonto closed my account without warning while my recall request was being processed.Qonto closed my account without warning or explanation. I had recently requested a recall after money was accidentally transferred to another account. In their statement to me, Qonto stated that they had 10 days to make the recall request. However, once the recall had been made, Qonto later realized with my help that they had not submitted the recall in the correct format. After receiving messages reassuring me that the recall would be sent correctly, Qonto stated that it had been sent in the correct format after 30 days. After I raised the fact that 10 days had expired, I received an email informing me that my account would be closed in 72 hours. Due to this, I have lost over â‚¬11,000 in total.
reponses: Hello Temi,First of all, we are sorry to read your comment and that our collaboration has to stop suddenly.We are not authorized to comment publicly your dossier. However, despite the closure of your account, rest assured that we will keep you constantly posted and we are doing our best to facilitate the recall of the funds.As an ACPR-accredited payment institution, we are sometimes required to take some difficult decisions when our client operations or activity do not allow us to meet our legal obligations.We are sorry for the impact this closure may have on your professional activities. We also hope that you have been able to find a structure to welcome you quickly.We remain at your disposal, and we invite you to reach out to the agent that is following your dossier in case you would need any support.Have a nice day.

commentaire: I have a very bad experience with Qonto bank, they scammed me with a transfer of 30.000 Euro which I made in Aug 2021. in the beginning, they were trying to be nice to assist, ask me to provide them with a letter from my bank etc. then, in the end, they never replied to my emails. It's a very bad and horrible feeling to see a bank stealing your money. Avoid this bank it's a scam. The police are working on it now.

commentaire: Gives out your private email information to other companies. My third contact with Qonto - a customer service representative calls me. â€œI saw you have a bad review, I wanted to see if we could help youâ€Iâ€™m amazed. Finally customer service 6 months after I asked for help. â€œWe sent you an email the week following your questions, itâ€™s in your emailâ€ I check my email - no evidence in my inbox or spam folder. â€œAre you sure?â€ I tell the wonderful customer service rep. â€œYes, she says - â€œlet me resend itâ€ Then I get a notification from the Qonto app - the message she Iâ€™d sending as an email is showing up as a chat. â€œStill - no emailâ€ I tell her. She gets confused. Eventually she / I understand that when your logged into the app, the customer service messages gets sent as CHAT not EMAIL. We are in 2021 people - and this BANK didnâ€™t know how itâ€™s communicating with clients. I canâ€™t believe that this bank honestly doesnâ€™t teach its wonderful employees about its faulty systems - nor understands the importance of copying at least a ticket response to the contents email and not just sending a reply as a chat when the client can have notifications turned off. On top of this - The bank hired a marketing agency â€œSanibel Researchâ€ and gave my email info to them to research more about why I didnâ€™t use the bank. I hope itâ€™s obvious - if you canâ€™t get the basic right I wonâ€™t trust you with myself money - or my private information
reponses: Hello David,We confirm that we did not hire this company Sanibel Research or provided any private information to them. Regarding the communication tools we apologise for the confusion. Your first message to us was through a chat therefore you receive the response on the chat and not on your email.If you could send us the Sanibel Research email that you received, this will help during the investigation process.Kind regards,

titre_com: Very unreliable. Serious flaws in the organisation
commentaire: On the first look good, but serious flaws. I have had overall a good experience, but a couple of sitatuations that really brought me into critical siuations for my business. Transfers not being processed due to poorly managed AML processes (I worked in a bank myself). Today, after upgrading my phone, I cannot access my account as desktop requires an app pushup confirmation. However, I have a new phone. I was locked in in that app on my new phone, but not receiving these approval requests, but I still had access to my account. So I talked to support on the chat. They told me I would have to delete the app and reinstall them. I asked them if they were 100% sure this will work, and that I would lose access to my account if it didn't. Long story short. It did not work, there is an internal error on their end. They doung f... all to fix it. I have not had access to my account for days. You do not measure a bank how it works on good days. A bank you rely on for your business simply must be always there and reliable. Qonto is far from that. Qonto is not reliable. Do not bank on Qonto.
reponses: Hello David,Thank you very much for your feedback.The current situation regarding the linking of your new phone is of course very unfortunate. We fully understand that this is a big inconvenience for you and your business.In your case, we are working on fixing a specific and serious error in the linking of your new smartphone. Rest assured that our team is working on the case with priority and will contact you very soon with a solution to the problem.In any case, we thank you for your patience so far and for your understanding. Please feel free to contact us at any time if you have any further questions.

commentaire: Qonto is probably the worst account I have had, I had cancelled a transfer but the bank still sent the payment when it was time to refund me the amount that they accidentally sent. They told me I had to wait up to 15 days. They do notÂ care aboutÂ the payments I need to make withÂ theÂ money neither did they apologise for the misunderstanding or give me an explanation of why it happened. titre_com: Taking their client's need at heart!
commentaire: What's better than making a customer immediately happy? Sorting out things in a smooth and professional manner with an (initially) grumpy one! By doing so, you create long term engagement and show that you truly care for your customers. I have been very impressed by the level of care and responsiveness I received from the onboarding team at Qonto. They dealt with a (minor) issue very proactively and with very high standards, showing laser-focus attention to their client's needs. Chapeau bas!

commentaire: I have been very happy with Qonto up to end December 2019, and was even paying the higher premium for the services they offered... that's until they decided to shut my account with no reason given. How can that even be possible ? I have invested a lot of time and effort in order to use Qonto services... had I known they could and would close my account without any explanation, I might not have spent the time and effort. As this came without warning (they're giving me 30 days to find another bank) and especially with no explanation, I figured it would be an interesting feedback. And it apparently was, because since I originally posted this message, I have received great support from Qonto.So big up Qonto, and thanks for your support and service

titre_com: Customer service is slow and poorly informed
commentaire: Customer service is slow and not technically proficient. They wasted over a week just to figure out that the 'titre se sejour', my residence permit won't work for them. I have salary setup and an account with another bank in France with it. The lack of experience with something basic is usually a sign of possibly bigger issues down the line so it's good to know early.
reponses: Hi Vishal, we've read your feedback very carefully and we truly want to inform you.As a payment institution approved by the French Prudential Supervision and Resolution Authority, we carry out rigorous checks on given documents by our future customers when they open an account.Documents validations are therefore essential to ensure a trustworthy business relationship, which will be in full compliance with our account validation guidelines.As far as the refusal to enter into a relationship for non-compliant documents is concerned, this is subject to internal guidelines, which may of course seem to you to be subject to exceptions.Â We provide all these information on this dedicated page, which I invite you to consult: https://support.qonto.eu/hc/en-us/articles/360001133218-What-kind-of-identity-documents-are-accepted-by-Qonto-

commentaire: All was great until...One day I decided to refund one of my clients who lives in Turkey, as it is not possible to send money there, I just decided to send them to her sister who lives in the UK (SEPA bank area), which I did before with the other bank and the transfer usually arrived next day, but not this time. Check out the time line:April 8 bank transfer, one week no news...April 14 I receive an email in French, which I donâ€™t know (my account was open in Italy) and I just dismissNext days I start to call and they tell me that the bank called me April 14 and couldnâ€™t reach, so they just sent me a message (in French?!)April 21 I receive a message asking details for the transfer, I answer two days after and again nothing... no answer no explanation April 29 I call again, they check, no answerMay 6th they send me a message asking exact same details they asked on April 21 (really?), probably they lost the message or whateverSame day I answer once again, same thingsAfter couple of hours I decide just to cancel the transfer...I text the bank that I want to cancel it in the end, they confirm, I asked also if the commissions (~25â‚¬) will be refunded as well and I receive a negative answer, they didnâ€™t transfer the money, but kept commissions, great client serve!May 13 I finally have the money back (after more than one month), transfer all the funds, close my account.I hope that you wonâ€™t have same problem with this bank and will find my story useful for you!
reponses: Hi Vitali, we've read your very complete feedback with attention and we truly want to have a phone conversation with you, next week, in order to react to your message, and inform you!Are you available for a phone conversation, next week?Please let us know when you're available, on our dedicated email address : feedback@qonto.euThank you very much, and have a nice weekend!

To find something in the app I really need to go in circles to find it. For example , Iâ€™d like to change the plafond per month but to date I still can not change it. The support team though is very responsive to any questions, fast and very active. A huge plus.

commentaire: After having spent the last three weeks trying to open an account with BousoBank, I could not recommend them any less. After providing all the correct documents and even going to the effort of translating them, I received an email saying my application had been rejected. I then called in an attempt for my information, however was subsequently told that this was confidential in very rude manner that made it clear that this was not at all of importance for them.  I have never had any issues previously opening any accounts nor had such bad service. Don't be tricked by the price or offers not worth it.

commentaire: First they wouldn't let me open an account without any explanation or help (while I have multiple other accounts in French banks and a very-well-paid CDI). Then once my account was opened, there was a small registration error. To fix that I've been on the phone 6 times, had to send them physical letters, fill in 4 online forms. They tell me it's fixed but it's not - twice. They send me an email from a no-reply email address asking me to send them things via a reply. What they say on the phone contradicts what's written on their website. There are bugs on their forms and ridiculous restrictions (like 2mb allowance for 3 full attachments). They have no tracking of previous service conversations, so every conversation is from 0. Small problems that would have taken in countries like Australia a short message/call to fix in a few minutes has taken a month+ with no resolution.The full experience was in fluent French (I'm bilingual) -- I can't imagine how bad it'd be if you had to do it in English.

titre_com: How I am supposed to pay with my VISA?
commentaire: Last VISA payment attempt: the amount (<35â‚¬) is on my account (even if the card is in credit mode), the payment limit is way far from being reached... still rejected.This is now the third time in a row (of 72 hours) that I am not able to pay (online) with my VISA issued by Boursorama, although I have used the confirmation with double checking process using their App, and I even tried with connecting to my account on a computer and receiving an SMS... rejected, tell me why please!I tried Eliott from the web service, this is the most useless and stupid piece of software that exists, it has not clue and keep looping on some obvious nonsense or this that can be read in the support documents and FAQ (let you feel stupid, keep your documents sorted you don't need this tool).I have tried phoning... or being called back to be accurate, guess what is answering: Eliott... you can listen to its stupid nonsense, assuming you did not get the looping message while reading the first time.The number behind the card is for insurance purpose only, so I bothered someone for nothing... BUT IT WAS A ACTUAL PERSON, pleasant and kind too, thanks madam!Be aware: you cannot even block the card phoning there, very surprising (as all the other banks I know are offering that).This specific point is the first part of the reason why I am writing this review.Second is that I wrote a message 72h ago using the contact form on my customer account on their website and have not received any answer back (just a confirmation of sending the message, which was correctly done with a copy of my original message and questions)...So please guys tell me why it is not working, with all the confirmation techniques and methods I tried?How to proceed to use my money?P.S. the "Cruise API" is returning an error code: CSC 7200058, if it helps?Last but not least: how do I speak with somebody?Best Regards

titre_com: The Boursorama customer service is going down the drain
commentaire: I used to be very satisfied with this online bank and I have been a client of Boursorama for many years, but recently, the quality of the service has seriously deteriorated. I need to make an urgent bank transfer abroad. For security reasons, Boursorama has blocked the various bank transfer requests I made online. Consequently, I sent them an email through their portal asking for support, so the transfer could be made. While I got a notification acknowledging that my email had been received and that I will receive a confirmation to my email address, I never received such a confirmation. Furthermore, when I check on their website the history of my requests, I can see that the email request that I sent to them does not appear. I have tried to call the customer service several times and each time I got connected to a completely useless robot. As a last resort, I have requested to be called back. So far, no one has called me back. The bank transfer is urgent and I am completely stuck with a non existing customer service. The next step will be for me to close my bank account.

commentaire: An absolutely terrible bank - at least in the last 6 months or so.I joined them as the default option when ING withdrew its French operations.To begin with, they were OKNow, there is no possibility - literally, none - of getting help in a telephone conversation with a real person.  'Help' consists of the most limited 'chatbot' I've had the misfortune to come across.  It is possible - common - to reduce a request down to one key word and for it still not be understood.  The only other option is by emails, which are 'answered' in 48-72 hours, in a formulaic way, showing that there has been no attention paid to the substance of the problem or - even less - to resolving it.My issue is, in a sense, my own fault.  I made two purchases on Facebook and both turned out to be complete scams.  It's the first time I've ever fallen for this in 15 years but, as I used my Boursorama Debit Card, I knew I should be covered.The only way to pursue a matter like this is by using a pro-forma procedure on their website, which is not remotely adaptable to individual circumstances.  Because I did not have a proper 'contrat de vente', the procedure would not allow me to press ahead.  When I emailed their Customer Services with an attachment containing all the information they required and more, I was asked to send them screen shots of why their procedure had not worked for me and, afterwards, to repeat the exercise.I'm taking the advice of the service juridique of a consumers' association I belong to and will follow the route they suggest, rather than just saying good bye to my money.  However, I've certainly decided to close my account with Boursorama and would advise anyone else to do so too.Utterly pathetic.UPDATE 20 MARCH 20241.  I received yesterday a pro forma message from Trustpilot, to the effect that Boursobank were requesting evidence of my identity, further to the above comments, and that, if this were not forthcoming, my review would be deleted.  I have replied with my customer ID number and IBAN number and will be interested to see if, and how, Boursobank finally respond.2.  My requests for reimbursement of the monies fraudulently taken from my account were refused summarily by Boursobank.  Both my new French bank and my existing UK bank have confirmed that they would have reimbursed the money without question.3. I have also noticed how many of the positive reviews are "invited" - perfectly legitimate, of course, but worth bearing in mind.

titre_com: Boursorama claims to be an easy to dealâ€¦
commentaire: Mise Ã  jour:Boursorama, non content de recevoir un avis client nÃ©gatif, l'a dÃ©noncÃ© Ã  Trustpilot comme "non basÃ© sur une expÃ©rience rÃ©elle". Or, cette expÃ©rience est bien rÃ©elle, et calamiteuse. Ce procÃ©dÃ© de dÃ©nonciation par Boursorama est au mieux malhonnÃªte. Un conseil : amÃ©liorez votre service si vous ne souhaitez pas recevoir d'avis nÃ©gatifs.Boursorama claims to be an easy to deal with bank. Well, not if you're a non resident... But it's not all. here are a couple of examples:- Opening an account : as a non-resident, you need to provide some tax documents. Guess what: Boursorama does not recognize the official tax return form issued by the tax authorities. Customer service is useless : an other department said "not accepted". Then you get cryptic messages : to continue your opening process you need to submit other documents... which are not specified. When you connect to the website, you can't upload them. So you call the customer service who tells you to send it by email. And then, black hole...In the meantime, you may receive a SMS saying that you need to transfer 300â‚¬ to the account to validate its opening. Guess what, despite doing this, the account may not be created. Then you need to wait for the 300â‚¬ to be returned and you stat over.- Customer service : very uneven. Some assistants are good and polite, others take you for granted and are the limit of being disrespectful. Explanations on when you receive a message, for what, are less than clear. Latest in date : received an SMS announcing my account is open, and I will get an email with my credentials. (after 3 weeks struggling with the customer service). I receive an email about credit of a bonus. But no credential. Call to customer service : we send credentials 48 hours after announcing your account is open. Ooooh. Thanks for being so clear in your communication!So all in all, the first experience has been a disaster. Let's see how the operations go... Wish me luck.
reponses: Non spÃ©cifiÃ©

commentaire: I am a client of Boursorama bank since June 2019, and I have recently applied to open LIVRET A for my two sons (one who was born in France, and other who was born in Pakistan). During the submission process, I was asked to upload the birth certificates which I did. For the one born in France, there was no issue as it was a birth certificate issued in France. However, for other, I received the following email with following point- l'acte de naissance est incomplet, la date et le lieu de naissance des parents sont absents du document. merci de nous faire parvenir une copie complÃ¨te du livret de famille ou une copie complÃ¨te de l'acte de naissance avec filiation de Muhammad et une copie du passeport du reprÃ©sentant lÃ©galThe issue is that the birth certificates issued in Pakistan have only the names of Parents and do not have dates and places of birth of Parents. Given that in Pakistan a document similar to livret famille does not exist, I have always provided this certificate to receive official documents for my son (Prefecture, Impots, etc) and have never faced an issue. However, to address this problem, I provided (parents) marriage certificate, our titre de sejour, our passports, etc to provide the proof and date of birth of parents. Given that, i am an existing client (and Boursorama has all my information) I did hope that this info will be fine. However, to my surprise, two days later I received a refusal for an account opening for my elder son. Anyways, I got a pseudo livret famille from the Embassy of Pakistan in Paris and reapplied. Again in a couple of days, i got a refusal.This whole episode is very strange for me. Because I do not understand why a DISCRIMINATION is being applied to one child and there is no issue for the other. Is it only because one has a birth certificate issued by a Town Hall in France while the other holds a birth certificate from Pakistan? Just to let you know the same birth certificate was accepted also by the ministry of interior of France. Therefore, i seriously wonder, if a document that is accepted all over, a bank is not willing to consider (and despite all extra parent-related information that was provided)Getting Livret A is not rocket science and i can get it with any bank (My other account is with BNP Paribas and they are after my life to get these plans for my children). After that i tried reaching out to multiple departments but all in vain. Yesterday, I received a letter from one Mr MEZARD. It is amazing how much attention is given to the details because the letter mentioned the reason as - application de nos conditions generals - but did not have the courtesy to specify what precisely is the CONDITION we did not fulfill. But that is because there is NO REAL CONDITION. It is just profile discrimination (possibly racism?) given that there are different documents (the one that had a French birth certificate had the account open vs. the other child having a foreign document). Anyways I have initiated the account opening with BNP Parisbas (Thank god they have the brains to relate). Of course, I will contact Banque de France but to launch a full-scale complaint and audit of the processes. I am also progressing with closure of my account and my suggestion to everyone will be to STAY AWAY from such a discorteous and disrecpectful bank with a useless customer service

titre_com: Everything was great until you sign up
commentaire: I initially gave a good review to anytime as they were great when we set up the account, which is for a new association. Our association raises money for people with rare diseases in Ukraine impacted by the war.  Now that it's time to send the money to the beneficiaries, we're told that you can only make transfers to SEPA countries with an IBAN number. Even countries outside of SEPA who have affiliated banks in the EU are no good because anytime won't let you make transfers using Swift anymore.  Since joining they have also completely disabled features to get or send cheques. (This may seem like not a big deal, until someone wants to make you a donation).  When you ask for help you get annoying AI generated responses inviting you to 'find another solution' but 'rest assured, you can still make a transfer via iban in SEPA.'  This account is very expensive for what it is. It's basically a scam. They understood where and how I wanted to send transfers when i set up the account and now there is literally nothing I can do except send the money to my personal account-so what's the point. Traditional French banks are slower and they don't like to open small association accounts so they will try to put you off, but honestly it's worth the hassle because this 'bank' really is not fit for purpose.
reponses: Hi Michael, We appreciate your initial positive review and we're truly sorry to hear about your recent experiences with our services. We understand the importance of the work your association is doing to support those affected by rare diseases in Ukraine during these challenging times, and we apologize for any inconvenience you've encountered.Our goal is to provide a reliable and efficient banking experience, and it's disheartening to hear that we've fallen short of your expectations. We understand that you've encountered difficulties with international transfers outside the SEPA region. We acknowledge that this limitation can be frustrating, and we're actively exploring ways to expand our international transfer options to better serve our diverse customer base.We apologize for the inconvenience you've faced with the disabled cheque features. While cheques have become less common in today's digital banking landscape, we recognize that they still hold value in certain situations. We will review the possibility of reinstating this feature or providing an alternative solution.Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention, and we hope to have the opportunity to regain your trust in the future.Sincerely, Barbara - Anytime

titre_com: I have been waiting for money to beâ€¦
commentaire: I have been waiting for money to be transfert 5 days already and now , they are telling me that my bank info have to be in pdf if not they can t process , what a scam ,it suppose to be business banking and it s the worse bank ever , can t wait to close that account .
reponses: Hi Aicha, We are sorry to read your disappointment. First of all, we would like to remind you that Anytime is subject to regulatory obligations that require us to perform regular and random checks on transactions.We apologise if this request seems intrusive. Please note that as a banking institution, Anytime is legally obliged to monitor transactions in the same way as a traditional bank. Therefore, we may ask you to provide proof of the origin of funds received into your account or proof of a transaction leaving your account.We note that you have provided the requested proof on your Customer Area, and confirm that your file is being processed by the department in charge. Kind regards, Barbara - Anytime

titre_com: Don't touch with a barge pole!
commentaire: Don't touch with a barge pole!It makes me doubt the veracity of the reviews here, had an account with them for 6 moths and it has been nothing but problems but it sort of worked with work-arounds. In September they suspended international payments, supposedly for the moth September, they are still suspended today 04/November/2021... And to brighten up my day, it seems to me all payments are now suspended, even within France as nothing goes out and transactions just evaporate from the system. And the customer service? As if it wasn't there... no answers, nothing...So, tell me this, how can a bank that has got all transfers suspended and doesn't answer help line get 4.5 stars???

titre_com: This was one of the most bizarreâ€¦
commentaire: This was one of the most bizarre experiences I've ever had - and with a bitter surprise at the end. The process of setting up the account is strangely quite long and complicated, it's done in three phases and takes a few days (a week?). The last stage is an interview on the phone with somebody who is very nosy and basically wants to know where your money is...But the cherry on top is cashing a chÃ¨que - it takes, please do sit down - 5 weeks! First I thought I'm reading it wrong and its 5 days but no, 5 bloody weeks. No way I'm staying. I read the terms and conditions before I started filling up the application forms and I read them again today, there is, obviously, no mention of this in the T&Cs, only when you first long on that they drop it on you. Neat. Plus the website keeps freezing, strange, very strange outfit.

titre_com: Probably the worst bank I have ever used.
commentaire: Honestly one of the worst banks ive ever dealt with. You log onto the website it says it has failed and the IT service are looking at it. It's been like this for months. You complete the capital deposit with them, which is actually a very good service, and in order to complete this deposit you have to sign up to the pro account. Once the account is set up you go onto the platform and have none of the pro features and they give you an option to pre-order the pro function. You call up the number they give you and it tells you to contact them through the site. It takes 3 days to hear anything back. Tried to make a transfer. Did not even recognise any of the 4 french IBAN I used. Tried to contact them but customer service is literally non-existent. I would recommend for the capital deposit but stay away from them if you are thinking of using them for banking.*Update since review* Anytime are quicker at getting back to you on trust pilot then they are on there own platform. If you want customer service just write a bad review, they will get back to you in a day. Since the review has been written they will not let me transfer money out of my account to close it. It sat pending for a week. When I asked them why it had not been sent they told me they didn't know. They called me back and told me the transfer would happen that day. The next day they email saying the transfer has been cancelled and to do it again. I did it again and I still havent had the transfer executed. They also tried to send me the card about 3 weeks after I had opened a pro account with them which failed even though a competitor bank sent me a brand new card next day to the same address. They claim they fixed the site. Issue is still blatantly there. Only when I write a bad review on trustpilot do they then provide me with the pro features that I paid for. Admission of guilt on their behalf. Tried to ask for a refund given that they had not given me the pro features, have not heard anything back in days. I just want do be done with anytime so I never have to have this experience as well but they wont let me leave. Last thing my accountant in France told me not to use anytime so clearly they don't have a good reputation. Be very careful about using them.

commentaire: I have been trying to hold off writing a review in this way, but my patience has run out.I set up an account with Anytime for my new French company. The aim, to buy a chalet and run it part as second home and part as business. The Anytime account was set up very quickly and efficiently. Obviously it would be, to get you on board.The first transaction was to be the property transaction, so I tested the account to ensure I could transfer funds in. I received my banking card. All looked good, efficient.I sent a message to the bank to inform them of the transaction and that they would be receiving 700,000 Euros, which I would then need to use to complete the transaction and develop the property. 30 hours later I get a message to say I can only send 10,000 Euros to the account, which can't have more than 50,000 in it. Too late, 30 hours is a long time and the funds have been transferred. This credit and transfer limit is a very material term. I still cannot see the terms and conditions that state it.8 days later, I still do not have the 700,000 Euros back, how crazy is that. The day for completion of the purchase has passed earlier this week. Signing has happened, but I have let the Sellers down. I have no way to access the funds, they are in the system.I keep asking for progress and providing all information requested. I may ask 5 to 10 questions in messages in a day. 48 hours at the earliest I get a reply to one question. The rest of the questions go unanswered. The Bank is faceless and you never get the same person answering messages. There is no conversation. You can't call.Banks have a duty of care to their customers. Duties around client monies are pretty high. These duties are simply not being respected at all.The Bank are saying that they are seeking to increase the credit and transfer limit. They know the urgency, but it has taken 6 days and still documents uploaded have not been looked at. When I ask if they can find the funds, they say it will be at least 7 days, but provide no rationale for this and no information on the funds. They have the transfer certificates, so they know they received it.This bank is set up for every day business. Anything not in the everyday mundane transactions will not work. They are unable to deal with specific requests, whether in chat, messages or on the telephone. They need to rework the model as all businesses have some extraordinary transactions.A faceless bank that shirks its responsibilities and hides behind the answers the internal systems give it.I hope they may right this and then prove me wrong, but I would be foolish to hold my breath.

titre_com: Could never have done it without SHINE!
commentaire: Just pure magic! As South African,widow,single mom alone in France SHINE helped me to create my own account after I struggled and tried 2 times on my own to create it through the "Chambre de Commerce" in France. It was impossible. They totally ignored my requests and it was so complicated. Thank you SHINE for all your support and hard work and always rapid and spot on replies and always explain all the questions for all of us to understand. I am for ever grateful. It is possible to start from Zero and have joy and happiness with the help and support of SHINE. Go for it!!! All worth it. I am not technology savy at all and the Application is super easy to use. straight forward. No nonsens and many clicks here and there. Just what you need.

What a a bunch of incompetent........Mama told me ask before shooting.The company does exist, its barely operating on 500nmÂ². The Shine account receives all card processing and online website income. Connected to all business related suppliers and debits and of course to URSAF. Anyone can look up nowdays a company if they have any doubt. Even a 5 years old sitting on a toilette can do that. Don't need a degree for it. The administration made a mistake and they corrected it. Maybe you should communicate with your own customers before you making decisions. Or hire a 5 years old to do that for you.

commentaire: DÃ©plorable le service client SHINE.Suite Ã  la crÃ©ation d'une entreprise il y a un mois, j'ai ouvert un compte en ligne shine, et alimentÃ© celui-ci.Alors que des transactions Ã©taient en cours type virement pour des fournisseurs, mon compte a Ã©tÃ© brutalement bloquÃ©.La raison Shine me demande de leur communiquer ma derniÃ¨re attestation URSSAF, je pensais pourtant avoir Ã  faire Ã  des experts.Je ne comprends pas dÃ©jÃ  cette procÃ©dure et ces mÃ©thodes de bloquer un compte ainsi que toutes les opÃ©rations en cours, car on parle lÃ  bien de compte pro.Ensuite les experts de Shine devraient se former un peu plus aux formalitÃ©s de crÃ©ation d'une entreprise, en effet les services URSSAF ne sont disponibles qu'Ã  partir de l'embauche du premier salariÃ©, et la crÃ©ation d'un compte URSSAF intervient que 4 Ã  6 semaines ensuite aprÃ¨s cette embauche, en cette pÃ©riode de covit des dÃ©lais sont certainement rallongÃ©s, sachant que nous venons de faire tout rÃ©cemment nos dÃ©clarations prÃ©alable Ã  l'embauche.Comment osez-vous donc bloquer un compte pro, en exigeant une attestation URSSAF pour une sociÃ©tÃ© qui vient d'Ãªtre crÃ©Ã©.j'avais Ã©tÃ© pourtant Ã©tait emballÃ© dans un premier temps par cette banque en ligne mais lÃ  je suis totalement dÃ©Ã§u avec, des fonds de plusieurs milliers d'euros bloquÃ©s.Je ne peux que constater l'amateurisme de #Shine d'autant plus qui n'existe aucun numÃ©ro de tÃ©lÃ©phone pour les contacter.Deplorable SHINE customer service. Following the creation of a company a month ago, I opened an online shine account, and funded it. While transactions were in progress such as wire transfers for suppliers, my account was brutally blocked. Reason Shine asks me to communicate to them my last URSSAF certificate, I thought, however, that I had to deal with experts. I do not already understand this procedure and these methods of blocking an account and all operations in progress, because we are talking about pro account. Then Shine's experts should be trained a little more in the formalities of setting up a business, in fact URSSAF services are only available from the hiring of the first employee, and the creation of a URSSAF account occurs  4 to 6 weeks after this hiring, in this period of covit times are certainly extended, knowing that we have just made our declarations very recently before hiring. How dare you therefore block a professional account, by requiring a URSSAF certificate for a company that has just been created. I had however been excited at first by this online bank but there I am totally disappointed with, funds of several thousand euros blocked. I can only note the amateurism of #Shine all the more since there is no phone number to contact them.

titre_com: The worst bank i ever came across afterâ€¦
commentaire: The worst bank i ever came across after HSBC. The customer service is helpless and rude. They do not understand that if you are blocked out of your account, you cannot send them an email ! You cant call them from abroad or it takes forever and when you do reach them they give you a lecture about sending them an email ! i say i cant and they say. Well you need to pretend you are not a client to email us if your account is blocked !? What??? They also block my account so often that i had no time to manage my funds in 12 months ! each time i am blocked. In the meantime i moved country, called them and they told me to unblock you need your phone updated. I said i am talking to you now and they said - no you need to pretend you are not a client to email us to do the change. WHATTTTTT? I did that and received an email threatening them to close the account. They responded with a letter called"closure of account'' giving me 30days to remove my funds to which they didnt sort out my access to !? they are crazy ! I never saw something like this. They then asked me to write a letter and sign and send them by email to ask to change the phone number ! This is the worst Bank on the planet, do not waste your time as i did please find another as i will and if you know another good one, tell me. These people are out of this world !

titre_com: Outdated and ridiculous fraud prevention policies
commentaire: Joined Britline nearly 15 years ago when I bought a holiday home in France. It is great to speak to English speaking staff, and whenever you phone them they are really helpful and pleasant and sort out your problems (as far as they are able). The staff on the phone and really excellent. However, now I have moved to live in France their policies really irritate me at least once a month. Despite having lots of money in my account, they limit how much you can spend each month! So this morning (close to the end of the month) they have declined an on-line payment of just over 50 euros because I have â€œover spentâ€ this month. I have phoned them to let them know we are having renovation work done so my out-goings are high, and they told me that I can phone each month to have my spending limit temporarily elevated for that month - this is my money in my account that they are refusing to let me spend! And money transfers above 4k euros require paperwork. They send the forms electronically (2 of them). These need printing out and signing - the two forms contain almost the same information. The forms then need to be scanned and sent back. They then phone you to check the details on the forms over the phone before approving the transfer! It would be difficult to imagine a more useless process to prevent fraud - because preventing fraud is their justification for these outdated and ridiculous practices. If I didnâ€™t have loads of direct debits already set up with Britline I would definitely move banks. I would not recommend them.

titre_com: If I could give them zero stars
commentaire: If I could give them zero stars, I would. The Britline representative who conducted my interview was rude and hostile. After answering many invasive questions, I mentioned that the Britline website included information about a simplified account for only 1 euro/month. The agent seemed surprised that I would want to open that type of account since it does not include a debit/credit card. He asked me numerous questions about why I want to open the account and what I would do with it. I explained that I would receive my salary in the account and then use it to pay my bills; I simply donâ€™t need a card. Eventually, he agreed to open the simplified account for me. When I hung up the phone, I was happy because I do not need a credit card. A few minutes later, he called me back and said that the simplified account option was no longer available and only their 10 euro/month account is available. I expressed dissatisfaction with the false advertising and the retraction of the earlier promise. But I relented and agreed to pay the 10 euro/month fee in order to open an account. A few minutes later, the same agent called me again in order to inform me that Britline had decided not to allow me to open an account because I was â€œargumentative.â€ Apparently, Britline expects you to kiss their rear ends for the privilege of opening a bank account with them. The entire experience was a huge waste of time and extremely unpleasant. I do not recommend this unprofessional and unethical organization to anyone.

titre_com: âš ï¸ WARNINGâ€¦ Do not trust your money withâ€¦
commentaire: âš ï¸ WARNINGâ€¦ Do not trust your money with Britline Credit Agricole Normandie.  June 2024:  My aunt recently passed away just under two years after opening her account with â€œBritlineâ€™ Credit Agricole Normandie. We opened it as it offered English speaking customer service agents and as she was elderly and felt more comfortable speaking on the telephone rather than doing anything online.  Four months to the day after she passed away, I signed her succession documents in the Notaires office.  I noticed while going through the paperwork that the balance transferred to the Notaireâ€™s account by CA Normandie â€˜Britlineâ€™ was different to the balance on the paperwork they had sent over for the balance on the date of her death. â‚¬629.15c euros was missing. I asked her if the bank had sent a statement of transactions (debts) and interest accrued (credit) since my aunts death and she replied no. Over a three week period I rang the bank enquiring about this matter as a family member holding power of attorney and acting on behalf of the next of kin. The bank said they would only deal with the Notaire (French State Solicitor). I feel this was inreasonable. However when requesting three times over three separate phone calls that the bank send a full statement to the Notaire, they repeatedly failed to do this. I checked with the Notaire twice and she said she had received nothing in the form of a statement (debts/interest) originally from CA Normandie when they first sent my aunts bank date of death statement and nothing since explaining the charges. On contacting the bank the third time, they decided they would speak to me. I was able to find out where the â‚¬629.15c went. â‚¬9.15c was on a special â€˜direct debitâ€™ (no explanation for what it wasâ€¦ it just stated â€˜special direct debitâ€™). The remaining â‚¬620.00c was for â€˜Succession Documentsâ€™ (Inheritance bank statement). These consisted of two A4 pages â€˜Britlineâ€™ had sent to the Notaire. These two pages listed the sole account number and â€˜balance on date of deathâ€™ on one page and a 9 line paragraph on the other page with the Notaires address and customers name and details. The nine lines was â€˜standard phraseologyâ€™ required information that would be expected on anyoneâ€™s bank statement. There were no special circumstances or further paperwork or explanations. When speaking to the same bank manager who opened the account two years earlier he talked for two minutes about â€œall the reasonsâ€ for this â‚¬620 charge. It was a lot of over inflated hot air. He even went as far as to state that â€œdecisions about who the inheritors were..had to be madeâ€. I had to point out that this was complete rubbish because one, that was the Notaireâ€™s and State of Franceâ€™s responsibility and two that had been established before the bank was even aware their client had died. He was just making rubbish up on the spot to try and justify a â‚¬620 euro charge for sending out two A4 pages. In contrast, the accounts held by my aunt with Allied Irish bank, Bank of Scotland, The Halifax and La Poste, all sent out the same two A4 pages andâ€¦ their letters started with their condolences and some (even if fake) respect considering my aunts death. All those financial institutions didnâ€™t charge a penny, not one penny to send out those same letters and the banks statement for each account.  When speaking to the manager, there was a distinct air of contempt as he ate food while talking on the phone and one could really sense the â€˜I donâ€™t give sh**â€™ attitude hidden under the pretence of professionalism. Every time I pointed out something relÃ¨vent he simply replied â€˜uhmmmâ€¦â€™. Complete contempt for the situation. It made me completely aware that Britline saw opportunity for â€˜easy moneyâ€™ â€¦someone elseâ€™s money as they rub their hands. Banks are banksâ€¦Iâ€™m no fool. They are just there to make money no matter how beautiful the Black horse advert is (Lloydâ€™s) or how the nice the individual person is you speak to in the moment. However a good judge of the quality of a bank is how they act when things are going wrong or you have a problemâ€¦ not when things are going well and you donâ€™t need their help. I strongly advise potential customers to clearly understand what â€˜hiddenâ€™ charges their bank has and ask direct straight questions when opening any bank account so you understand how you will be treated when you wish to close that account or transfer money.ğŸ”´ I cannot recommend â€˜Britlineâ€™ CA NORMANDIE as a bank to trust your money with.  They failed to divulge to the Notaire what the charges were for. They failed to list any interest accrued even if it was zero (â‚¬0) and treated family members with contempt and the deceasedâ€™s bank account with opportunism.

reponses: Bonjour Jon Jeremy,Je vous remercie de votre avis et je suis dÃ©solÃ© de ces Ã©vÃ©nements.Pour information, pendant le changement de partenaire bancaire (Visa vers Mastercard) nous avons automatiquement envoyÃ© la nouvelle carte Ã  l'adresse renseignÃ©e sur votre compte bancaire.Si votre nom/prÃ©nom n'Ã©taient pas affichÃ©s sur la boÃ®te aux lettres ou si vous avez dÃ©mÃ©nagÃ© sans nous signaler votre nouvelle adresse : la carte ne peut pas Ãªtre livrÃ©e.Bonne journÃ©e,Tom.

titre_com: Terrible in virtually every way (yes asâ€¦
commentaire: Terrible in virtually every way (yes as people say they have a nice looking app), which will not help when it comes to the inevitable issues. Very low withdrawal limits which can not be raised (they say in reply below that they can - but the requests are denied for no reason with no explanation and no way to change it, very low limits, imagine being outside France and this being your only source of money if something went wrong, no way to call to increase the limit, even in France there are no branches so no way round this). Impossible security. No way to contact them (except sending 500 max character messages for very urgent matters that get automatic refusal responses days later). Instant chat customer service can not actually do anything and are extremely rude and short with you, actually cutting-off conversations mid way. Constant glitches and app/website issues, often can't complete a simple procedure for many days (and of course there is no branch to go to or way to phone them). No way to use it on a computer without your phone. If you can not walk into the bank - you need better than this to rely on for your main account. Can't imagine anyone risking this as their main or only account, you know for sure at some point things will go terribly wrong. If you plan on using it as a backup account for some simple things it might be ok, I would never trust them for anything significant. The online idea is a good one, but they totally missed the target with this, it can only survive here because the competition is so terrible and expensive in France.

titre_com: Horrible bank for doing transactions to other banks
commentaire: Whenever I do a bank transfer they ask me for more info:"As part of our compliance checks, we have had to temporarily block this IBAN "******************" until we have verified the identity of the beneficiary. In order to be able to unblock the situation, I would ask you to send me a PDF version of the RIB, and to tell me whether this account belongs to you, or to give me the first and last name of the holder of this IBAN as well as his or her date of birth, if the account belongs to an individual. For your information, RIB means â€˜RelevÃ© d'IdentitÃ© Bancaireâ€™ in French. It is a document issued by the bank holding the account. It is the account's identity document.This document includes: the name of the account holder, the name of the bank, the IBAN of the account and the BIC code. We advise you to record the IBANs with the full names of the holders to avoid this situation again."How insane is this. That means I would need to contact the recipient and they need to provide me a document. SO weird and unusual.

titre_com: hi bad experience with sumeria I hadâ€¦
commentaire: I had a bad experience with the online bank Lydia, which I really liked, but it was replaced by Sumeria Bank. Unfortunately, my experience with the latter was very disappointing. Here's what happened:I received a notification informing me that I needed to fund my account for upcoming direct debits, which I did immediately. The next morning, when I checked if the direct debits had gone through, I discovered that Sumeria Bank had charged fees on the money I had deposited. These fees were supposedly due to unpaid direct debits.This experience was very negative for me. When I complained to customer service, a representative confirmed that the fees for unpaid direct debits could not be waived. He also explained that the bank had the right to charge operational fees to its customers.

titre_com: Refusing to return balance after wrongly closing account
commentaire: This is a horrible bank.They opened my account without problems. I needed a European Bank account as I was moving from Asia to Europe.When I made 3 transfers to my own bank account for a total of around â‚¬16k, they asked for source of funds. Fair enough, I provided them the paperwork.Then they wanted a copy of a bank statement for the last 3 months of my Bank in Asia. Fine, here you go, even digitally signed by my bank.Next thing I knew, I couldnt login anymore. They closed my account. No email, nothing.When emailing them it appeared they didn't understand the Asian paperwork.The undertone I got from some of the employees (Samira & Viginie), made me feel like I was some sort of criminal and they had no intention of helping me.After all this I didn't even want an account with them anymore, but I wanted my balance back.I don't want to have discussions with a bank, I want a bank that treats me as a customer. I sent them the account details of my bank in Asia. The Bank where the funds originated from.While they accept SWIFT payments to their accounts, they will not send payments back on the SWIFT system.They informed me that until I provide them with a European account, they are holding my funds. An account that has to be transferred to with the SWIFT system is not capible with Lydia. This seems like the world upside down to me, but fine, I will involve (a) lawyer(s) now to get my balace and maybe expenses made. Not really what you want when opening a simple bank account, but be prepared for it if you start doing business with Lydia..7 November 2023 A quick update. Since I have posted on this medium, what I have let them know to be completely transparent, they have not responded to any of my emails. I have emailed them every day so far and even tried to make life easier for them offering them the opportunity to do a SEPA transfer to return funds, as they requested.Since they do not pick up any phone calls on their number +33179754030, the only form of communication I have is email.It seems to me they are trying their best to stall the situation, until I give up so they can keep the funds.I will keep updating this post, also if it ends positively, but so far it isn't looking good.16 November 2023Last week I have again emailed Lydia to inform them I have approached legal representation in Paris and am waiting for them to advice me.I have also let them know what legal firm I will be using.Again no response whatsoever.I was under the impression that the email was ignored again, but to my surprise I got a phonecall from the bank that I used to send funds to my Lydia account from (not Lydia).The transactions I had done have been reversed and will be back on that account soon (will update).I explained the situation to the other bank and they were absolutely discusted. The impression I now have from the company Lydia-app is that they have no problem violating your rights as a customer, holding your funds as long as they can, but quickly bend down and return them as soon as they have to deal with qualified legal representatives.Not the best impression to leave and if anyone would asks my opinion prior to opening an account with Lydia, I would advice strongly against it.An email with apology from Lydia to me should be send, but chances are low as then they would have to admit wrong doing. If by some miracle this does happen, I will also be fair and publish this here.For a financial institution, hiding under the blanket is not a pretty sight.24 November 2023After a tiring time consuming fight Lydia has returned my funds and I have now received them.The conclusion is that Lydia refuses to send them back in a normal way, but when the process of hiring a lawyer is started, they suddenly give ot back.BE AWARE! Do not use this bank!
