titre_com: I had to try accounts from 3 different EU countries before I could transfer my money
commentaire: I signed up to this app on the insistence of a French client so she could pay me (I'm not based in France). It was a pain in the a** to transfer my money. They claim you can transfer money to any EU or UK account, so I tried 2 EU accounts (Revolut - Lithuania and ING Austria - and neither went through). I couldn't even find ING Spain on the list of banks (they seem to mainly list French banks and some in other French-speaking countries). Finally I was able to send money to myself via text and use my Spanish IBAN to collect it. Thank god I have bank accounts in three different EU countries to choose from, otherwise I wouldn't have been able to get my money. Incidentally, UK bank accounts do not have IBANs, so I don't see how you could actually transfer money to a UK account (as they claim you can) given that they don't provide the option to insert an account number + sort code (which all UK accounts use). Save yourself the trouble and use revolut or transferwise instead.

titre_com: Terrible experience, don't use for big events!
commentaire: Used Lydia for a large event. Their interface is appalling compared to Fixr or Q-pay. It is very difficult to use, even for tech-savvy people. We ended up making our own spreadsheets. Their helpline was slow and often flat-out did not reply to us. It doubly charged a lot of people, so we had to give refunds, incurring the booking fee. They forgot to pay us for some of our transactions. They promised benefits such as Â£1 per new customer but have still not paid us the cashback - it's been over 4 months, meaning there was literally no benefit in using them over others. Save yourself the aggravation and don't use!
reponses: We are sorry if you had a bad experience with Lydia Pro. In order to help you, can you write to supportpro@lydia-app.com ?

commentaire: A useful payment service when you don't have a problem, but the moment you start having problems it's a NIGHTMARE !!!I've been a strong advocate of Lydia during the past 1+ years until I realized I've landed my foot in the "merde". They never listen to their customers. Terribly disappointing service. They don't have a direct channel through which you can contact in case of emergency. They never reply to emails, only until I Tweeted them. They first kindly ask me for my phone number and e-mail, as if they are going to go through my requests. But of course, they have never read my previous requests and I have to explain my problem again. Their answers are not at all sufficient and do not address the problem I'm going through. Each time, they come back with new support personnel, making me explain my situation once again. I've wasted the last two weeks and still my problem not solved. I have 450â‚¬ blocked in my Lydia wedding cagnotte, I still have no clue whether I can withdraw this money, if yes, how... Or at least, if I cannot withdraw this money, what will happen to this money ??  In the meantime, they've been sending me a couple of promotional marketing emails. Is this a JOKE ?? I've told them multiple times that I need to withdraw the money asap because the wedding is in only one week. ONLY HAD THEY SPENT AS MUCH TIME ON CUSTOMER SERVICE AS THEY DO ON MARKETING EFFORTS...  No wonder why you have so small number of users and 2,5 rating on Trustpilot. Next time if you ever organize a cagnotte, I recommend using Leetchi and reimbursing your friends use Revolut or N26. At least they have a reliable customer service. COMPLETELY USELESS. Lydia should simply stay as a reimbursement service between friends. You are mistaken if you think you have found your perfect Neobank, because Lydia is not and never will be.
reponses: Non spÃ©cifiÃ©

commentaire: Je suis un client satisfait de La Poste Ma French Bank depuis environ 3 ans.  Jusquâ€™Ã  ma conversation dâ€™aujourdâ€™hui avec lâ€™un de vos agents du service client, jâ€™aurais recommandÃ© vos services Ã  tout le monde.  Cependant, en raison de l'attitude et de l'impolitesse de l'homme avec qui j'ai parlÃ© dans votre service client aujourd'hui Ã  10h30, mon opinion sur Ma French Bank a complÃ¨tement changÃ©.  ironiquement, j'ai contactÃ© votre service client car j'Ã©tais en train d'ouvrir un compte chez vous pour ma fille de 12 ans.  Potentiellement, elle aurait pu Ãªtre une de vos clientes Ã  vie, mais elle a entendu ma conversation avec votre reprÃ©sentant et son attitude grossiÃ¨re. Sa rÃ©ponse a Ã©tÃ© qu'elle voulait ouvrir son premier compte bancaire auprÃ¨s d'une autre banque parce qu'elle n'aimait pas le ton de votre reprÃ©sentant.  avec moi et moi non plus.I've been been a happy customer of La Poste Ma French Bank for about 3 years. Until my conversation today with one of your customer service agents,  I would have recommended your services to anyone and everyone. However, due to the attitude and rudeness of the man I spoke to in your customer service department today at 10h30, my opinion of Ma French Bank has completely changed. ironically, I contacted your customer service department because I was in the process of opening an account with yourselves for my 12 year old daughter. titre_com: Trying to make contact with MFB isâ€¦
commentaire: Trying to make contact with MFB is virtually impossible. I telephoned endless number of times, waited for more than half a an hour - still no response. There is no email address one can use to contact them. Disgusted by the impossibility of making contact, I wanted to close the account. Only way to do it, send informatiion by registered post. A week later, received email confirmation of reception of my letter (no-response email address), stating my account would be closed within a month!! A month, ridiculous. No doubt they just want to be able to make another monthly account charge. KEEP WELL AWAY FROM MFB.

There was no way i could access my money (they wouldn't allow me to transfer money to my partner or a friend, so that i could have some cash). 1,5 month ago, i sent a letter to close the account. I am still waiting on my money (even though it supposedly should take 30 days). The people at the hotline are completely useless. The only thing they can do is blame whatever is happening on other service providers (the post office for the cards i never received, my email provider for emails i should have received but never did, etc.). If i didn't have a partner, i wouldn't have been able to eat, pay my rent, live my life.

commentaire: well i contacted them because i noticed some weird activity on my account . after 2 days i contacted again asking why i never got any response.i was worried because all my money is in that account , if someone hacked it, that means they had access to everything. i had a message from someone called maryam , the message was not what i was hoping for.no explanation or anything.  That message could have been written in a nicer and better way.i have been a client of hello bank for the last 2 years , and it was my main bank, it s a shame to change my bank because of one bad experience , this is a first. others were nice enough to explain the situation and get me a refund .

commentaire: Orange bank was about to close, Hello Bank was then suggested as an alternative.My partner has a residence in France but does not speak English. The advisor I had on the phone said communication would be a problem, thus it would be better for him to open an account in one of their offices. Sounds to me more like passing along a "problem" he doesn't want to deal with. When told we were opening an account upon the recommendation of Orange Bank, he broke the number 1 rule of sales personnel. He said and get this, you are not obliged to open an account with us, it was only a recommendation. Bad vibes started from the message he left on my mobile. I played it 4 times to try to catch the name of the company. Never mentioned. This holds truth, one who can't handle small tasks, cannot achieve excellence anywhere.

titre_com: negative experience of Orange transfer to Hello bank
commentaire: If you are ever an expat moving to France you will likely know French banks are unnecessarily discriminatory to the point it feels like racist behaviour.  Well I have an account with Orange Bank and pay all my bills in France thru it.  We are emailed to say Orange is closing and offered an account with Hello,  expected to Agree to the transfer of all my information, closure of one account and opening of another.  Offered cash for moving and upsold unwanted premium features, hours obliging this to be declined an account with zero explanation or knowledge of what happens now to my account funds!  Once again I feel that banks are pooping on its customers?  At least provide a credible customer service link not a robot!!  I see in the threads this is not going well for with Orange or BNP?  I don't like some expats of travellers think that French banks should speak English - but at this point due to the unhelpful and discriminatory actions - I do feel I will just withdraw all my money and avoid business in France.  Its shameful and bad business, people will remember and eventually you will loose!  Not surprised Orange was a flop!All customers are valuable, perhaps a bit of care?

commentaire: iOS app limited to those with 'France' selected as the country associated with their Apple ID.So, if you recently moved (or moved back) to France then you cannot use the app without changing the country of your iOS account (which means that some of your other apps will stop working).Wretched, awful example of a normal bank pretending to be a real online bank. titre_com: It's hard to recommend Hello Bank
commentaire: It's hard to recommend Hello Bank at this stage for the following reasons:1. While the staff are friendly on the phone, they have been so disempowered and poorly informed that there isn't any point in calling them because they can't do much.2. It takes several days for anyone to respond to messages via the app.3. The apps and integration are last-generation. Adjust your expectations of functionality.We can't say we weren't warned; the promotional materials show a picture of a customer literally bending over backwards in order to use Hello Bank.

commentaire: This bank is bad! The overall experience of having an account with Hello Bank is just horrible! They opened my account and shipped me a Debit Card with an "anti-filter" fraud. In their world, this means I can't do online transactions, contactless transactions, normal transactions or add my card to Apple Pay, etc. Basically, by enabling the so-called anti-fraud filter, they have made my card useless. When I contacted customer service they gave me different answers for why it was not working. None of them fixed it. I had to face the embarassment of having a â‚¬5 transaction rejected in front of a whole supermarket queue.

commentaire: As an existing client of BNP Paribas, I proceeded to open an account at Hello Bank. Thinking I would be able to open an account faster (since Hello Bank is the property of BNP Paribas), my request has been declined a couple of days later.I then proceeded to contact their Customer Support, which told me that they had studied my request, but declined it "without giving any additional information", indicating "they are not required to provide a reason".Stay away. Horrible honestly. If you're truly looking for an online bank, try Boursorama Banque instead. I've had no problem ever since I joined them a couple of months ago (plus they support Google Pay, unlike the useless and slow Paylib system supported by Hello Bank).

Weird waiting times between every new service you want to add to your account, 24h approval for new beneficiaries, 48 hours to have any change approved, 5 days for random codes to come to you by post (often at the wrong address..) this bank should be called slow bank. titre_com: The reasons why you should not use Hello Bank
commentaire: There have been a number of issues. Setting up the account was very straightforward. Once you deposit money into the account, it is very difficult to transfer and withdraw money. Anything over 6,000 euros requires approval. It takes a number of days before you can get access to your own money.Large amounts over 100,000 euros require various information which was supplied and accepted, yet validation of the sums can only be signed off by one person in the whole of Hello Bank. This could take a number of days to validate. The staff were very hostile and unhelpful to the extent that one customer service advisor refused to speak English and said that she was forbidden to speak English with me.I phoned up and was given various information by a number of agents, stating that my transfer would be signed off the following day. I phone up again to check and was told that the manager to sign off was not in until after the weekend. I made if clear that this is my money, I am not asking the bank for their money. I did everything I needed to do and am still awaiting my transfer to be validated. I have now had to engage a solicitor to act on my behalf, which will cost me money to have Hello Bank release my money. There is no complaint structure to get any help or satisfaction from this company. You are left to the incompetent and unprofessional customer service advisors, misinforming you and preventing you from releasing your own money. I therefore advise anybody who is thinking of doing any business with Hello Bank or subsidiary to stay clear. This is from a very very very dissatisfied and unhappy customer. If I can put a rating on Hello Bank, there would be no star. I am still waiting for my money to be released and no valid explanation has been given to me.

commentaire: First, Hellobank = BNP Paribas. You have to know this, especially because that point will get ridiculous quite fast. The loans that you get are signed by BNP Paribas, the emails that you send are received in a single mailbox. This proves to be a pain as, if you have both a BNP Paribas AND an Hellobank one, the advisor you'll end up talking to will be lost in that sea of messages, and won't understand what you're asking for.Also, if you manage to obtain an exemption from early repaiment indemnities, they'll give you an endorsment. But it's probably gonna be a fake one, like mine. They put issues in it and then, after several years, the day you need it, they'll refuse it and say that endorsment wasn't actually aiming at YOUR credit. you can prove that they send it to you, you can prove that your name was on it, you only had ONE credit, but no, they'll say it's not yours. What... And don't expect that you're gonna be able to repay with your own money when you sell you appartement. No no no, that won't work either! They'll tell you that it's not your own money. It's the money of another bank (Hellobank VS BNP Paribas !!!), so it's not yours. That's usually when your head blows off.After that, when the reimbursment is finally achieved and you expect to be done with it, know that, even if you suscribed a BNP insurance (Cardif), it won't close by itself. No no no, you even have to do communication within the enterprise for them. They're probably sending mail through horses between their buildings and they get lost on the way...There's also no free immediate transfer unlike other online banks.They're gonna ask you for handwritten stuff like in the 90sSponsorship is scarce, not that interesting and easily refused.To sum it up, it's quite hard to get a worse online bank, I'd suggest to go... just anywhere else.And for the notice, I can prove everything I said.

Non spÃ©cifiÃ©
